description:
In this issue we learn the origin of the Silk Spectre against the backdrop of a debate between her and Dr. Manhattan. They talk about wether life on Earth is worth saving. Through this discusion we get to see the progression of a young girl whose Mother was afraid of aging so tried to make her daughter just like her in order to live a second youth through her.

We also get as much of what happened with the original Silk Spectre, and her involvment with the Comedian. Giving us even more insight into the identity of Laurie Jupiter. This final bit of information makes Dr. Manhattan come to grips with the miracle of each individual life.
name: The Darkness of Mere Being

description:
The house comes crashing down on them, and Diana grabs Julia and Vanessa. Decay has a hold of Diana's tiara and dares her to approach her to grab the tiara. Neighbours gather around to see what the comotion is, as Decay laughs an evil laugh and shoots up to the sky. Diana looks high and low in the sky for Decay while the Olympus gods question whether she is suited for the job of defeating Ares. However, Hermes has faith in Diana as it has been decreed that if the Man's World were to survive, then their salvation must come at Diana's hands.

Meanwhile at Hanscom Air Force Base, Etta Candy is searching through General Tolliver's office, looking for Steve Trevor's file. She finds it, and marked on it is "Ares Project". She takes photos of it, and carefully locks up, taking caution. Then the night guard calls her over and points her to the TV, in which a report of a glowing object is seen in the sky. The local foilage has also begun to rot. Moments later, the reporter reports that the decay is spreading all over the city.

Across the city, Decay unleashes her breath much like a hurricane. The Boston Massacre Monument soon topples over but Diana catches it just in time, saving people right under it. Holding the monument, she tosses it at Decay but before it can even reach her, it turns into powder. More of the press arrive, as Decay tells Diana about the humiliating death she will soon suffer. Diana fights back with a "Or yours Decay... once I get my hands on you!" but she reminds Diana that she has created so much havoc in Boston City, and she has hardly lifted a finger.

Diana charges for Decay but her emotions have clouded her thinking, and she forgets about Decay's special touch. Diana starts aging, yet she tells Decay that she will not admit defeat. Decay tells her that she will turn into dust and be one with the Earth. Then, Diana remembers the Lasso of Truth - she wraps it around Decay's neck, as the lasso always renews, as Gaea renews the Earth. Decay continues to struggle as ironically, the lasso pours life into Decay, who is made of death. Decay, screaming, explodes and her body falls to the ground, turning into dust.

The camera crews rush over the Decay's carcass, as Wonder Woman flies down to put her tiara back where it rightfully belonds. The camera crews then suddenly rush over to her, and she is surrounded by flashes and questions she does not understand. Confused, she flies back up, looking for Julia.

Meanwhile, Phobos is furious at Deimos' plan of Decay. Deimos fires energy blasts at him and Phobos is hanging over the edge. Deimos tells him that his attempt at killing Diana may have ruined Ares' plans and lets Deimos to fall.

In Boston, the editor for the Boston Globe-Leader Newspaper, Carole Bennet stares at the photo of Diana. Realising that the Daily Planet's sales skyrocketed after Superman appeared, she knew that she had to have Diana on the front page. She needed a name for her. She noticed a bird of some sort and a stylised "W". She smiles as an idea comes to her. The following morning, the city is buzzing with the front page having Diana and the title ""Wonder Woman! Mystery heroine saves city from Deadly Demon of Destruction".

In northen Boston, Etta returns home from shopping and enters her house as Steve is sitting on the lounge, shocked that the woman on TV was the same woman who saved him. With that, Steve sets out to find Diana along with Etta. Little do they know that Colonel Michaelis is following them.

Vanessa is at Mercy General Hospital where the doctors do not know what is wrong with her. The doctors cannot heal her and as they leave, Julia starts crying. She then hears a voice, Diana's voice in fact. Julia is filled with joy and asks her if she has found a cure. Diana still doesn't understand English very well but shows the Talisman and through that, tells her that this is Julia's fight as well.

They both arrive back at home and Julia studies the Talisman as Diana looks out the window. Just then, she sees a shadow amongst the trees and Julia finds herself alone. Julia looks around for Diana as a gun is trained on her when Diana wraps the lasso around the man's wrist. They then recognise each other and Steve asks for her help again. Diana does not trust him though, as he was the messenger of death. Suddenly, Etta shrieks as Colonel Michaelis is seen holding a gun with Etta against the car, unconscious.
name: A Long Day's Journey into Fright!

description: Tyler Flynn has a habit that's as bad as any drug, and has cost him as much: treasure hunting. Rather than family and friends, however, THIS time, it has cost him his world.

deck: The year is 2032. Corruption, prostitution, and cameras are everywhere; from the top of what's left of the American government to the bottom of the sleaziest pit imaginable. When former vid star Reuben Flagg is drafted into the Plexus Rangers, he's sent to Chicago, a cesspool of gang violence, dirty politics and urban warfare. It's enough to crush an ordinary man but Reuben is a survivor and with the help of his new friends, he just might be the man to put it all back together.
description: The road trip starts out with a bang as the car runs out of gas, and Reuben has to find a town on foot. What he finds, however, is a community guarded by a mysterious cyborg, trapped as a scarecrow in a cornfield, and a murderous group of people that speak in advertisement copy. Suddenly, everybody wants Reuben dead and with the cyborg temporarily out of commission, there seems to be nobody sane left to help.
name: Scarecrow

description: Badger has to help Yeti fight an ancient demon that has been summoned by IBOB.Â  Can Badger beat the horrid demon......BOB
name: Bob
Victory And The High Price Of Victory

description:
Jackson Guice steps in as guest penciler. Nexus journeys to Procyon to visit Scarlett and Sheena, forcing a showdown with Ursula. Meanwhile, Kreed and Sinclair run amok when Nexus entrusts them with a mission to clean up a list of mass murderers on Mars. Needless to say, The Merk is less than pleased.

6 page Judah The Hammer backup story, At The Bridge: by Baron and Calimee.
name: The Visit

description: Walter, now Wanda, Langkowski visits Scramble to see if he could revert his body to a male one, but Scramble is unable to do so since his powers only work on humans, not the bodies of gods. Meanwhile, Roger Bochs feels despair over Aurora's affections for Langkowski and mentally snaps. He attacks Alpha Flight and Madison Jeffries kicks him out of the Box armor so he can't hurt himself or others. The new legs that Scramble has grafted on Roger Bochs also seem to be decomposing.
name: Friends.... And Lovers

description:
GANG WAR CONCLUSION

Has the battle been won? Kingpin returns to being the crime lord of New York, but Spider-Man and Daredevil still want words with him. Betty makes a horrifying discovery about Hobgoblinâs identity!
name: Gang War Rages On

description: The Avengers choose a new leader! Their selection is a shocker!
name: Command Decision

description: Captain America's investigation into the illegal body-building techniques used by the Super-Patriot may spell Cap's doom. Plus: premiering the hardest-working henchmen everâ the Sweat Shop!
name: Movers and Monsters

description: When Stephanie takes her new friends home to meet her family things don't turn out quite like she imagined. Plus, things go bad when one of their own is kidnaped.
name: Kidnaped

description: Johnny and Alicia's honeymoon is interrupted when people start mysteriously disappearing without a trace! It seems even vacation can't keep the Torch out of the game for long, as he goes head-to-head with Project: Survival!
name: To Flame No More!

description:
While the Hulkbusters are trying to capture and kill Rick Jones, Clay Quartermain calls in a special request to the morgue.

The Hulkbusters are after Rick Jones' Hulk but Bruce doesn't want them to susceed and then turn into Hulk again, the gray Hulk, using his machine. That same machine the Leader - without his powers - has been seeking to regain his powers, but the Hulk destroys the machine at the end. A guy named Ramos is looking for Betty, saying she is his wife.
name: Inconstant Moon

description: Iron Man unveils his special deep sea armor for a government mission to stop enemy forces from opening an old toxic gas tank in the wreckage of the Titanic.
name: Deep Trouble!

first_appearance_objects.name: Iron Man Hydro Armor Mk. I

object_credits.name: Iron Man Hydro Armor Mk. I

description: A top secret U.S. jet fighter goes down in international waters and the government asks Kickers Inc. to rescue the pilots! A tie-in with Mark Hazzard: Merc #7.
name: Clowntime Is Over
Is This The Way The World Ends?

description: The Wrecker is a man torn up inside as he must decide between fighting Spider-Man and Spider-woman or going to visit his dying mother. However, while the crowbar-wielding villain is contemplating his decision, one of his teammates, Thunderball, ambushes him! It's a wild four way fight among Spider-woman, Thunderball, the Wrecker, and the web-slinger!
name: Sudden Impact

description: The Minstrel and the Sage are mistaken for spies and captured. They tell two stories about Groo. In the first story, Groo is giving the job of spying on King Kohon's enemy. He brings back the wrong information. In the second story, Groo is dispatched as a messenger for King Kassabist. He succeeds in delivering the wrong message to the king's general and the armies of the king end up divided. Groo shows up at the camp where the Minstrel and the Sage are being held and is mocked by those who heard the stories. In the ensuing fray, the Minstrel and the Sage are able to slip away.
name: Spies

description:
In the aftermath of Ken's battle with the Old Man, he finds himself lost in space. Now he must not panic and keep his wits about him, or the power of the Star Brand will fail and he will perish in the cold void of space. But that can't happen for he has a date with destiny.

He manages to figure out how to get home and sees Duck, who's in the hospital after being hurt by the Old Man. Then he goes to see Barb, who breaks up with him. He starts to get paranoid about the Old Man--did he really kill him? He finds out the answer is No, because the Old Man starts leaving threatening messages all over the place, demanding the return of the Brand. The Old Man finally calls and says he's going to kill Duck if Ken doesn't show up.

The Old Man has his hand on her throat in the hospital. Ken shows up and says he'll have to kill her, because he won't give in, the Old Man is too dangerous to have the power of the Brand. The Old Man is stunned at his response, and Ken takes advantage of the moment. They battle all over the area, and Ken apparently kills him, throwing his body into space. He goes back to Duck so they can be together.
name: The Reckoning!
All In The Family / The World Well Lost for Love

description:
PETER B. GILLIS (W) â¢ BRENT ANDERSON (A)

What will become of the first generation of Morituri champions of Mankind now that the even more amazing second generation of super-powered human warriors is ready to battle the alien Horde? For Strikeforce: Morituri, whose members are fated to die within a year, retirement is impossible! But acclaim is not - or is it?
name: Foray for Holowood

description: Note: Fin Fang Foom in this issue is actually Midgard Serpent in disguise.
name: There Were Giants In Those Days

description:
Dazzler versus the Juggernaut! Plus, a train session with the X-Men and Callisto!

On Muir Island Dazzler, Longshot, Psylocke, and Rogue train.

Dazzler and Callisto get into an arguement and Allison decides to take off and go into town. She goes to Black Neds Pub on the Northwest coast of Scotland.

Outside the pub she is about to leave and suddenly a speeding car almost hits Allison, she see's who is driving the car, it's Cain Mariko (The Juggernaut). She decides to take him on by herself, big mistake. After the battle The Juggernaut thinks he had killed his Idol, The Dazzler.
name: Folly's Gambit

description:
Spidey bags a coupla crooks who are breaking into a train carriage. While doing so, though, he inhales some weird gas. One of them (Willy) gives him a fake sob-story about having a family to support, etc and Spidey lets him go.

Later, at the Bugle, Pete sees a news report where the two crooks he busted are also wanted for stealing a big charity fund. He realises he's been duped and goes after the crook he let go. He stops by at Josie's Bar to get some crook info but some police sirens almost give him a seizure as, presumably, the gas is affecting him

Meanwhile Willy is having a run-in with the other crook (Gunther) that he left for Spidey at the start. The police couldn't pin anything on Gunther and now he's looking for revenge. Willy leaves an ad in the Bugle for Spidey to meet him at the train yard cos he wants protection. Pete has another seizure at home.

Pete sees the ad but, because of his condition, is worried about going into action as Spidey. He decides to go for it though and goes to the train yard. Gunther is there also, terrorising Willy. Despite another seizure, Spidey manages to stop Gunther and get the charity money back from Willy. 'Several' days later and Spidey's feeling fine again.
name: Nothing to Fear

description: How can the West Coast Avengers reverse their continuing slide back in time? The Ancient Egyptian pharaoh Rama Tut possesses the answer - but will he reveal it?
name: Lost In Space And Time, Part 4: The Sands Of Time

description: The mutant X-Factor rescued in their first mission confronts the woman he disfigured. Does the woman forgive him or has she secretly plotted revenge?
name: Playing With Fire!

description:
When Magneto reaches the largest surviving fragment of his former base, Asteroid M, the X-Men's war against the Soviet Super-Soldiers and the Avengers really begins!

Summary

After a quick recap, a three way battle erupts between the Avengers, Soviet Super Soldiers, and the X-Men. As the Soviets and Avengers duke it out, the X-Men take the opportunity to flee, taking Magneto with them. Dazzler stops Captain America and Crimson Dynamo after they attempt to follow her.

After the X-Men escape, the Avengers trick Darkstar to trap all her teammates in her dark energy constructs, departing and leaving them all trapped for another hour by their own teammate. While they do this, Magneto departs the X-Men group to go look for the asteroid on his own.

Captain Marvel spies on the X-Men's location using her powers, and relays it off to her team, the Avengers. Magneto finds a huge chunk of his asteroid, including one of his old costumes, and he puts his old helmet on. The Avengers arrive and attack him, nearly defeating him.

The X-Men then come to his aide, and as the two teams fight, Magneto tells them that the Asteroid is rigged with an explosion. Using the explosion as a distraction, Magneto takes the X-Men in their jet and flee, but apparently unknown to the X-Men, Doctor Druid is stowed away in the back of the Blackbird.
name: Uneasy Allies

description: Exercising their right to arm bears Dark Horse has Boris spoof Rambo!
name: Boris the Bear

description:
It seemed like Christine Spar's travails were over after her battle with Tujiro, but they've only begun.

Argent can feel that she has arrived back in New York. Wiggins fills him in, and tells him that they've arrested Brian. Argent says to let him go.

Meanwhile, Brian is getting sweated by the police. Once again Christine's actions are having unintended consequences on her friends. But Brian stands up to the cops and doesn't say anything. Ultimately they get the word to let him go, and they do, but Detective Riley is taking this whole thing personally, and doesn't like it.

Regina shows up at the destroyed theater and buses while Brian is checking them out. They meet and compare notes. They find her letter to Brian and decide to go back to New York together to find her.

Christine is arrested immediately after getting off the plane. They take her to Argent and Wiggins, who confront her with being Grendel. She denies all of it. They can't prove anything because she mailed the mask and fork back separately, so they have to let her go.

Riley hears that Brian is getting on a plane, even though Riley told him to stay in San Francisco. He runs out and gets his own ticket.

Regina finds Chris at her apartment and they bond over what she's been through. Regina sympathizes. She says Brian is with her, and Christine is worried; she didn't want him to get hurt more by any of this.

Unfortunately, that's exactly what happens. Riley shows up at Brian's hotel and beats the hell out of him. When Chris and Ginny arrive, Chris is furious. She leaves abruptly and gets her Grendel mask and fork from the locker she mailed it to. She had wanted to leave the identity of Grendel behind her, but now she takes it up once again.
name: [After the Devil]

description:
This issue may be read through the discovery of the free online archives at http://www.elfquest.com . you can thank Wendy & Richard Pini for their hardwork and generousity of the complete series there.

Aroree escapes and brings Windkin into the underground Blue Mountain cave-palace. Dewshine secretly has travelled with them on the great hawk. As soon as Aroree enters, Winnowill senses everything that has transpired on the outside of World of Two Moons and calls them forth.

Dewshine sneaks into Blue Mountain, while Aroree presents the Infant before the Chosen Eight (10 in elf-counting). But while Aroree offers the Child, Dewshine has arrived, and Tyldak witnesses it flying towards his mother. The Chasing commences.

Power of the Soul-Name Revealed

While Dewshine is stealthy and able to hide in Blue Mountain, Winnowill knows her soul name, and so has found Dewshine's spirit-form whereever it may be. When Winnowill sends

"LREE...!

COME TO ME...!"

it delivers a telepathic impulse that paralyses Dewshine and is heard by all of her family, most especially Scouter. It is moments like these that eventually set Dewshine against her indifferent recognised mate, Tyldak and become Scouter's lifepartner.

Somnabulence

The capturing of Dewshine and Windkin evidences for Aroree, the corruption of her cave kingdom. All besides the Chosen Eight (10 in elf-counting), are a shade darker towards the sleepier side of somnabulence, floating haplessly around Egg Egg's Egg, dreary-eyed.

#Kureel, one of the Chosen Eight (10 in elf-counting), congratulates Aroree but then arrests her, and Aroree is left but with the choice to kill him, so she does, becoming automatically expelled from the Gliders, and leaving the Chosen Eight with Six.

Business with Olbar & the Humans

We learn that Olbar, Nonna, & Adar all live with the Wolfriders in the Siege at Blue Mountain Series in #2, and in their prosperous town, consisting of straw-mud huts and a city-wall made of fags, Cutter visits them.

Olbar expresses that he mistrusts elves, but he and Cutter essentially leave on good terms. This is not the same human-tribe who worship the Gliders as Bird-Spirits. Olbar is afraid of the Preservers because they hid #selah his daughter from him for a whole year (SEE EQ #10)..

Cutter begins his mission of diplomacy, as Nonna & Adar set off with him to try and finally befriend Nonna's former tribe, the Bird-Spirit-Worshippers who live at the foot of Blue Mountain. They will arrive to greet Scouter there in EQ:SaBM#4.
name: Part 2

description: Astoria's trial begins. She confesses to killing the Lion of Serrea, but states there are circumstances behind it. Powers condemns her a sorceress and a slut, and Cerebus asks her if she considers herself to be a prophet.
name: The Trial
The Damage Done

description:
Xavier's School for the Gifted was completely empty. All the bedrooms were unused. Magneto's desk had photographs of his family, and in his diary was an appointment with the Hellfire Club.

As the Starjammers carried out repairs, Professor Xavier tapped into the minds of the New Mutants. They relived the slaughtered bodies in the Morlock tunnels, seeing the X-Men emerge weary & defeated, and images of the original five X-Men dressed as X-Factor the mutant hunters. The professor couldn't bear it any longer, but Lilandra couldn't accept his desire to return to Earth.

Back on Earth, Storm rode a derelict cruise liner along the stormy coastline. She passionately defied the violent weather with the determination that one day she would have her powers restored. The old ship began to fall apart, as Magneto tore it up to create a storm-break to protect the local town of Leesford. He was concerned that the locals would tear it down if they knew it had been constructed by a mutant. They then discussed the offer to join the Hellfire Club. Storm believed it was an excellent opportunity to have one more allie and one less antagonist for the X-Men to worry about.

Back in space, the New Mutants used their powers to help repair the Starjammer. Outside, Cannonball flew equipment around, Magma spot welded, and Warlock acted as a bubble to protect Cypher. Inside, Hepzibahmade snide comments about Lilandra and her insane family members. Lilandra settled the matter by punching Hepzibah while her back was turned. The fight was interupted by the holographic image of Wolfsbane begging the Professor to come quickly.

Magik had locked herself in her quarters, and they were afraid that without her they would never go home again. The professor commanded Karma to posses Magik's mind & open the door from the inside, but Mirage objected. The Professor pulled rank, and so Magik was forced to open the door. While under Karma's influence the Professor began to interogate Magik. She began to cry and confessed that she didn't want to go back to Limbo or re-assume her Darkchilde persona. Magik blamed Karma and Mirage blamed the Professor. Before he could argue his reasons he was distracted by something unseen and telepathically commanded Cannonball & the others to return inside the Starjammer immediately.

The Starjammer began emergency procedures, and Binary pulled Cannonball & Magma back inside before the attacking nuclear explosion could reach them. On deck, the Professor gave Hepzibah instructions of where to fly, while the New Mutants were being thrown around by the erratic manoeuvres.

The Professor was wrought with doubt. He wanted to return to Earth to ensure the New Mutants' safety and confront his old pupils in X-Factor. However, Lilandra begged him to stay with her and to continue using his telepathy to help save the Starjammer. He made up his mind and commanded Magik to teleport the New Mutants back to Earth, via Limbo. When she refused, he commanded Karma to posses her again.

Back at the school, Magik screamed at her team-mates. She couldn't trust them, and threatened violence against them before teleporting back to Limbo. The others didn't blame her for being so angry, and began to wonder how long they had been gone.

In the Hellfire Club, Magneto and Storm prepared to be accepted into the Inner Circle. Magneto ripped off the frilly shirt and changed into his red & purple costume. Although Sebastian Shaw objected, the White Queen accepted them. Jointly, Storm & Magneto were accepted as the White King of the Hellfire Club's Inner Circle.
name: Teacher's Choice

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

name: Teran English Edition

description: Airboy has to explain what happened to Valkyrieâs apartment while Hirota deals with a hijacker on a 747 in âArtic Deathzone.â Issue also has a âCalifornia Girlsâ pinup and âThe Winged Wolfâ in which Sky Wolfâs dad has an adventure with Pancho Villa. Â
name: Arctic Deathzone, Part 1; The Winged Wolf, Part 1

description: A Russian army surrounds the downed 747 that Hirota is on and Airboy and Sky Wolf race there to help in âArtic Deathzone â Part 2.â Issue also has âThe Winged Wolf â Part 2â in which Sky Wolfâs dad has to deal with plenty of foes while on a train ride. Â
name: Arctic Deathzone, Part 2; The WInged Wolf, Part 2

description: Mephisto snares the soul on an X-Man!
name: The Devil You Say

description: Airboy and company go against the Russian army surrounding the downed 747 in âArtic Deathzone â Part 3.â Issue also has âRetreat from Hellâ in which Sky Wolf goes on a joy ride with Black Angel and it turns into something else. Â
name: Arctic Deathzone, Part 3; Retreat From Hell, Part 1

description:
After being shunned by her best friends, at her high school reunion, Rebecca "Becky" Golden sought comfort from her caretaker, Lawrence Cartajel. Golden, Cartajel, and Thomas Czuchra, responded to a distress signal from a Japanese Trawler. During the course of the rescue, Czuchra, as the Elemental known as Monolith, sank to the bottom of the sea. Golden, as the Elemental known as Fathom, searched for Monolith. Fathom, though, found herself lost in the ever darkening depths. Fathom learns that, through an unorthodox use of her powers, she is able to see in the dark waters.

Fathom's newfound ability to see in the depths, however, brings her no closer to finding Monolith. In frustration, and despair, Fathom cries out for help. Astonishingly, her cry is answered by a beautiful, golden-skinned, aquatic man. Fathom is powerfully drawn to the man, and succumbs to a brief romantic encounter. A strange sound draws the man away from her. Fathom tracks the golden man, by scent, to a strange underwater colony of fish men. Feigning godhood, Fathom persuades the fish men to take her to their medicine man, Kotatu.

Surprisingly, Fathom can understand Kotatu, who recognizes her as an Elemental Sea Spirit. Kotatu gives Fathom a tour of the city of Talmira, educating her on their way of life, and culture. Kotatu is certain Fathom has come to Talmira, tasked with some holy mission. Fathom, however, only seeks the golden man. When news of a demon approaching Talmira reaches them, Kotatu determines that vanquishing the demon is Fathom's true purpose. Fathom discovers that the demon has assumed the form of a monstrous, burning crab.

Fathom fights a losing battle against the horrific crustacean from Hell. After escaping the crushing grasp of it's claws, Fathom levitates the Hell crab on a pressure bubble, until it explodes in the shallower depths. All of Talmira celebrates Fathom's victory, showering her with gifts and accolades. Fathom demands to see the golden man. Kotatu ushers her into a hidden chamber. There, the corpse of the golden man hovers, suspended in an energy shield. Fathom angrily confronts Kotatu, only to be rendered unconscious.
name: Rapture Of The Deep

description:
Jonny Quest #13 - Things That Go Bump In The Night

With Race Bannon recovering from his injuries in a hospital, Benton, Jonny, Hadji and Bandit travel to a remote town on the Main Coast, only accessible by train, to help Doctor Quest's friend, Professor Howard Phillips. It seems the home the Professor just purchased, Blackgables, a.k.a The Devil's Manse, is haunted.

27 pages

Comico Hype includes a small illustration of the cover of Comico Attractions #7 which features Space Ghost from the (then) upcoming Space Ghost comicbook by Steve Rude.

This issue also features a full page ad for Jonny Quest #
name: Things That Go Bump In The Night

description:
Three great stories! Concrete by Paul Chadwick, The Vitruvian Man by Steve Mattsson, Marc Badger, and Art Nichols. Fossil by Tony Salmons.

Chapters

Concrete: "Water God" - Concrete tries out a swimming rig and is pestered by some over-enthusiastic kids.

Gene Shock: The Vitruvian Man: "Growth" - Gene recovers miraculously fast from the bullet wound he received. He feigns illness to avoid raising suspicion. When he sneaks out, his sister finds pictures of a superhero costume that he's been drawing. When he sneaks back in, she discovers more bullet wounds on his body...

Roma: Chapter Three - Roma meets, and very quickly becomes close to Alex Trace - Salinger Mass' assistant. Miss Bron gives Roma a little insight into why she has been raised as a human despite her alien nature.
name: Concrete; Gene Shock: the Vitruvian Man; Roma

description:
Superman gets mixed up with Cat Grant's personal problems, while Concussion (of the Circle) hunts the Man of Steel in "Old Ties".

Notes:

  • First appearances of Adam Grant and Joe Morgan.
name: Old Ties

description: When Dick Grayson is injured by the Joker, Batman decides to go solo in his war on crime. But how long will this last...when he meets street kid Jason Todd. Part 1 of 2
name: "Did Robin Die Tonight?"

description:
Synopsis

The Teen Titans and Blue Beetle have been in a battle with Mento and the Hybrid for three issues know and noting has been resolved.Â  The friend (Curt Calhoun) Blue Beetle was trying to save has turned into Prometheus and is under Mento's control.Â Â 
Â 
**Spoiler Alert**
Beetle and the Teen Titans try to stop Mento and his mind controlled minions, but through a series of retreats the Hybrid gets away and Beetle if let with wondering how he is going to save Curt and how he is going to explain it to Curt's family and friends.Â  The Titans reassure him that they will not give up.
name: Prometheus Unbound!

description:
When Hawk (of Hawk & Dove fame) gets involved with a plot to lower the world's population, Booster travels to Mexico to prevent it in "Dream of Terror."

Cheshire breaks into US Biotech a Booster Gold International Company and kills several guards. She searches the lab for a certain Bio-chemical that is missing from the lab she is able to get a lead to it's whereabouts by dry rubbing the last sheet of paper on a day planner. She's not there long before some more guards find her. She defeats them and takes of for Mexico in search of the Bio-chemical.

Because this is a Booster Gold property Booster wastes no time in investigating the crime and is there as soon as he finds out with Skeets and Jack Soo. After assessing the crime and searching for clues they correctly find that the crime was perpetrated by Cheshire. They also figure out that she is after Dr. Babich's pet project. They are not sure what it is but they feel if they find Babich they'll figure out what is going on. So, Booster sets out for Dr. Babiche's home with skeets. Jack Soo is left to investigate the lab to figure out what Babich was working on. When Booster and Skeets get to Babich's home only his wife is there. She tells them that he went to Mexico with Hank Hall and she is worried that he is âinvolved in Something horrible!â So Booster takes off for Mexico.

In Mexico Babich and Hall are talking about what the new Bio-chemical that Babich was working on will do. He tells him it will cure overcrowding and starving.

Shortly afterwards Booster tries to talk with the commissioner of Mexico and get him to help Booster find Babich and Hall. While he is in the meeting he talks to Jack on his wrist communicator. They tell him they found a computer disk under Babich's desk and that they are going to analyze it. While they are doing that the Commissioner tells Booster he won't help him find someone who hasn't even committed a crime. Jack comes back on the communicator and tells Booster that Babich has developed a virus designed to âeliminate undesirablesâ He has convinced Hall that it will only make a huge part of the population sterile.

Back at the office Trixie Collins a.k.a. Goldstar makes small talk with Dirk Davis and they decide to get together that night.

Back at Mexico Booster is looking for Babich and Hall when he gets another call from Jack who has found a map were he thinks Babich will release the virus.

It may however be too late because Hall dressed in his Hawk uniform and strapped into a glider ready to release the Bio-chemical. Babich knows this will kill Hawk but he feels Hawk needs to be sacrificed for the greater good. Just as Hawk takes off he is descended upon by Cheshire from what must be the quietest helicopter ever. She takes the container with the Bio-chemical in it and cuts Hawks scalp with her poisoned nails. This causes Hawk to plummet to his death but, at the last secant Booster grabs him. Hawk tells him it's a waste because he is going to die from the poison anyway. Booster then shoots down the helicopter with Cheshire and her Soviet contact in it. Booster of course rescues both of them but the Bio-chemical was in the helicopter and crashes releasing the chemical that kills Babich. Booster reverses his forcefield to project it around the Bio-chemical. He then threatens to throw Cheshire in with the chemical if she doesn't give hawk a antidote to her poison. She resists at first but then relents and cures Hawk. Her Russian contact tries to convince Booster to sell the virus. Booster refuses and then shrinks the the virus with his forcefield and lets it bake in it's own body heat into a harmless piece of ash. Then he zaps the ash. After socking the Russian he leaves everyone in the desert instead of taking them into them into prison for releasing a virus that would have killed millions or stealing it to use as a military weapon for the Russian government.
name: Dream of Terror

description: Captain Atom's daughter is targeted, while Dr. Megala's shame finds its way into his dreams in âFathers' Day.â
name: Fathers' Day

description:
Meet the newest Scarlet Speedster: Wally West, who assumes the mantle worn by his mentor Barry Allen until his sacrifice in CRISIS ON INFINITE EARTHS! In this debut issue, while on his way to deliver a heart for transplant, Wally West comes across the immortal villain Vandal Savage!

Wally West is called away from his birthday party and asked to deliver a donor heart to Science Fiction writer Eugenie Hegstrom in Seattle. Along the way, he crosses the path of Vandal Savage. Savage just killed a police investigator who getting close to figuring out who he was. After engaging him, Flash arrived at the Seattle hospital. After been put in a room to rest, Flash went into see the writer in her room after the operation. Hegstrom asked to see the costume and then thanked him. When on the plane flying back to New York City there were terrorist trying to hijack the plane Flash took care of them in 3 seconds. At his apartment Wally won the lottery and was greeted by the 50,000 year old magician Vandal Savage.
name: Presenting...the new Flash

description:
A suicide attempt stuns the Vandemeer University campus. Ronnie tries to talk to Doreen about an unexpected revelation affecting their relationship. The perpetrator of the sabotage of Ronnie's helmet confesses.

Firestorm826's Panel-by-Panel Story Summary (Spoiler Alert)

âAy, but to die, and go we know not where; To lie in cold obstruction and to rotâ¦â

Shakespeare, Measure for Measure, Act 3, Scene 1

âSo odd to thinkâ¦Iâll never see this season again. A year from now, at the most the doctors say, Iâll be dead because of the brain tumor,â thinks Professor Martin Stein. âPart of the time Iâm angry; most of the time, Iâm scared. Above all, what I am is certainâ¦I donât want to die.â He stands, leaning against his desk in his office at Vandemeer University. He longingly gazes out the window, watching the first leaves of autumn starting to fall.

âProfessor Stein? May I come in?â asks the frail voice of Dr. Wendy Olsen.

âMm? Oh, yes, yes, Wendy. What is it?â Stein answers.

âYouâve been very reclusive lately, Professor,â she replies with concern. âSeveral of us have been wondering whatâs wrongâ¦â

âThereâsâ¦ahhâ¦itâs nothing, Wendy,â he answers. He takes off his glasses, cleaning the lenses with his handkerchief. âReally. Nothing you can do anything about.â

She watches him carefully. âI can listen, Professor. I know how to do that!â she says supportively.

âYes, yes, I know you do,â Stein replies. âIâ¦am not very good at talking, however.â

Wendy leans forward in her wheelchair towards him. âItâs not always what you succeed at, Professor, itâs what you try,â she says reassuringly. âAnd the truth isâ¦you donât have to try very hard. To have friends, you have to want to be a friend. And friends donât shut themselves off from others as you have, Professor!â

She turns and heads out of his office. Stein stares down at the floor. âTrue enough, Wendy,â he thinks. âPerhaps Iâm afraid of dying because I was never very good at living. Iâve kept people at a distance because letting them close always seemed to result in pain. Iâve alienated or let myself be alienated from everyone I ever knew. Lately that has even included Ronald, my other half as Firestorm. Iâve taken refuge in my intellect and flattered myself that, because it was larger than most peopleâs, it made me greater. â

Elsewhere on campus, Cliff Carmichael makes his way to the rooftop of a University building. Dark clouds hang in the evening sky. He somberly climbs the parapet wall and stands at the edge. He looks down, torn between jumping off the roof or climbing back down to safety. A tear rolls down his cheek.

âBut what have I to show for my âgiftâ?â Professor Stein continues pondering. âThe nuclear reactor I designed that was supposed to be my masterpiece blew up in my face. Now I even have questions about the basic safety and efficacy of all nuclear power! The accident at least created Firestorm, but even there I am merely a passive participant! Ronald makes all the decisions! I do have one decision to make. I shall not spend the days that are left to me ruing over what my life has or could have been! I will take the time and make something of it. Give it meaning; accomplish something that is worth doing. I will not waste the portion of life that remains to me.â

On the football field, Coach Percy confronts Ronnie after a drill. âRaymond, youâve been missing far too many practices here and even when youâre here, youâre not all here,â the Coach explains.

âYessir,â Ronnie replies.

âThat wonât do, Raymond,â Coach Percy continues.

âNo sir,â Ronnie answers anxiously.

âYouâre riding the bench, Raymond, until I see a change in you!â the Coach adds. âItâs not only me, Raymond! Your teachers are having the same complaints about you! Better clean up your act, son, or youâll find yourself not only bounced off the teamâ¦but out of the school! Understand?â

Ronnie stammers nervously, âUhhhhh, yeah. Yessir. Thank you.â Coach Percy turns and walks towards other players. âOh, wow,â Ronnie worriedly thinks. âI get kicked out of school and Dadâll kill me! I betterâ¦hey, isnât thatâ¦â

Doreen walks past. âDoreen? Hey, Doreen! Wait up!â Ronnie calls to her, jogging to catch up. âMan oh man! She must still be mad at me for when I had to cut out to fight the Parasite!â he thinks. âDoreen! Hey, câmon; give me a chance!â he calls to her.

She stops and turns to face him. âIâm through giving you chances, Ronald!â she says, looking sad. She then turns quickly and continues walking.

âWhat?â Ronnie replies, âHey! Câmon, Doreen! Wait!â He jogs to catch up to her again. âLook, I can explain about the other day if youâll just give me the chance!â he pleads.

âSoâ¦Howâs your father, Ronnie?â she asks, not breaking stride.

âMy father? Whatâs he got to do..?â Ronnie asks confusedly.

âYour father was the reason you left in such a hurry the other night, remember?â she answers as she glares at him. âNo, of course you donât. You donât even bother to keep your lies straight anymore! And donât you dare deny it! I followed you, Ronald! I saw you meet Professor Stein and then the two of you disappeared!â

Ronnie looks at her with surprise. âYou followed me?! Hey, what kind of trust is that?â he asks.

âAll that you deserve!â she snaps back at him. âWhy didnât you just tell me you had to meet Professor Stein? Unless thereâs some sort of connection between you two that you donât want me to know about!â

âWhat are you saying?â Ronnie replies hesitantly.

RRREEERRREE! âHey, whatâs with the siren?â Ronnie asks.

âSome guyâs atop the Nelson Building and heâs gonna jump!â a student tells Ronnie and Doreen as he runs past them towards the commotion. They quickly walk toward the nearby Nelson Building. A crowd gathers as police cars pull up alongside. People look up anxiously at a solitary figure standing on the edge of the six-story buildingâs roof.

âOh, no! Somebody stop him!â Doreen cries out.

The dark clouds overhead start to give way to a thunderstorm. Lightning flickers in the sky. âStormâs kicking up. Looks like itâs gonna be a bad one. If we donât get that kid down quickâ¦this windâll blow him off,â a student tells his companions.

A police officer approaches the base of the Nelson Building with a bullhorn. âHey, up there! Stay steady and relax! No one wants to hurt you!â he calls up to the figure on the roof. âWe just wanna talk, okay?â

On the edge of the building, at the lip of eternity, a young man wavers and fate decides. KRAKOOMM! Lightning blasts down and strikes the parapet wall of the Nelson Building!

It seems so slow. The body etched against the sky flutters like a leaf as it begins its fall. There is no time - - to scream, to run from revealing eyes, to call an orderly summoning of the power. If a life is to be saved, he must act now.

Doreen and Ronnie watch in horror as the man falls. Atomic rings start to dance in Ronnieâs mind. ââ¦Ronald..?â Professor Stein blurts out as he feels the unexpected pull of fusion beginning.

The falling body flutters like a leaf. The power is summoned. The girl starts to turn. The hero appears. âRonâ¦nie?â Doreen gasps as she turns to see Firestorm standing next to her. The truth is revealed. A second has passed.

FWOSSH! Ronnie leaps into the air! âRonald, what of our pact?â Stein asks quickly. âYou swore that, for the time being, I alone would initiate the merger!â

Ronnie speeds below the falling man. âUnless a life was at stake, Professor!â He answers. âYou yourself made that little condition, remember? And weâve got about two seconds to save someone who just jumped off the building!â

FZAAM! âAhhhh! Excellent idea, Ronald!â Stein observes as Ronnie aims a transforming beam at the man. âA parachute out of dust particles to slow his fall without breaking his neck!â Stein says. âHeâs still falling much too fast, however! Might I suggest now changing the parachute to a helium balloon? I believe Iâve calculated for a negative buoyancy.â

âWorth a shot!â Ronnie answers quickly.

FZAAM! Instantly, the parachute transforms into a large balloon. The manâs fall slows quickly. âYeahhh, thatâs done it!â Ronnie says as he watches. âLetâs land, Professor. I wanna find out who this geek is. Maybe send some helium down his throat and make him talk funny.â

The manâs feet reach the ground. Ronnie aims at the balloon. FZAAM! POP! Ronnie deflates the balloon with a small nuclear burst. He looks over the man standing there. âWhaâ¦Cliff Carmichael?â Ronnie thinks with shock.

Police officers rush up to Cliff, quickly grabbing him. âNice work, Flametop!â an officer tells Firestorm. âIf you hadna showed up, the kid woulda bought it for sure! Weâll take care of him now!â

Ronnie glares at his nemesis. âYou can drop-kick him into the Ohio for all I care,â he snorts and leaps into the air.

âRonald! That was uncalled for!â Stein chides him angrily.

âYou donât understand, Professor!â Ronnie answers. âI was right next to Doreen when Carmichael jumped! To save his crummy neck, I had to merge right in front of her! Do you understand what Iâm saying, Professor? Doreen knows weâre Firestorm!â Lightning flashes in the sky and a driving rain starts to fall. Ronnie circles around above the campus. âCripes! I canât see her anywhere!â he frets.

âRonald, calm down and think! The shock must have scared her,â Stein directs him. âWhere is she likely to have gone?â

Ronnie continues looking through the rain. âI dunnoâ¦her room in the dorm, maybe,â he answers.

âWhy donât we commence our search there?â Stein suggests.

Ronnie quickly lands near the Womenâs Dormitory Building. âIâll duck down out of sight here,â Ronnie replies. âProtect our âsecret identity,â always assuming we still have a secret identity.â Seconds later, Ronnie and the Professor step out of Firestorm in a flash of fission.

âDo you want me with you when you speak to Doreen?â Stein asks.

âNo, thatâll just scare her more! Sorry, Professor, but I gotta handle this by my lonesome,â Ronnie answers.

Stein nods and turns to head back to his office. âJust as well,â he thinks. âI want to know why the Carmichael boy tried to kill himself and this way I can get started.â

A short time laterâ¦Ronnie, still in his football uniform, walks down the hallway of the Womenâs Dorm. âSheâs not in her room, sheâs not in my room, sheâs not in the loungeâ¦where is she?â he wonders with concern.

âRon!â a voice calls to him.

Ronnie turns to look behind him. âOh hi, Bree. Listen, have you seen Doreen?â he greets Bree Brandon.

âYeah, sheâs over in my room,â Bree answers. âSheâs all upset and she wonât say why. You guys fighting, or what?â

Ronnie sighs. âSomething like that,â he answers. âListen, do you mind if Doreen and I just talk to each other for a bit, sort of private like?â

Bree nods. âIn my room? Okay, I guess so. Room 301,â she answers.

âThanks, Bree,â Ronnie replies.

âEs nada, Ron,â she says with a smile. Ronnie turns to head for her room. Bree watches him walk down the hallway. âAnd if Doreen doesnât want you anymore, you come right back to olâ Bree, you hear, handsome?â she thinks.

Ronnie finds his way to room 301. Nok! Nok! He raps on the door. âDoreen? Itâs Ronnie. Look, I just saw Bree and she said you were in here. We gotta talk, Doreen! Please?â he asks.

After a long moment, Doreen answers. âOkay. Come in,â she calls softly out to Ronnie.

Ronnie walks in and sees Doreen sitting on the bed with her back to him. âIâ¦uhâ¦I know it must be pretty weird for you seeing me change intoâ¦well, the other guy like that, but, honey, Iâm still me! The same goofed-up guy youâve always known. Iâm not a monster, Doreen..!â Ronnie starts to explain.

âI didnât think you were, Ronnie. But I donât know if youâre the âRonnieâ I knew, either,â Doreen answers. âI was a bit spooked at first by what happened, Iâll admit. But thatâs not the problem. Weâve been going together for a few years now, right? At least as long as this Firestorm characterâs been around, right? I thought we were in love.â She pauses to wipe tears from her eyes. âIâve always thought love was based on trust and caring and sharing,â she continues. âYou never shared this with me, Ronnieâ¦your being Firestorm. Just the most important thing in your life! Didnât you think you could trust me, or what?â

Ronnie walks next to her. âIt wasnât just my secret to tell, Doreen. Thereâs Professor Stein, as well,â he answers.

âDid you ever ask him? Was it important enough to you to push the issue?â she asks, hanging her head on her hand. A long, quiet moment passes. âI didnât think so,â she sighs sadly. âWhat does your Dad think about it? Does your stepmom know?â

âShe guessed. I havenât told Dad,â Ronnie explains.

Doreen turns sharply, pointing a finger at Ronnie. âShe knows but he doesnât?! You both keep it from him?!â she blurts. âRonnie, do you have any idea of what that might do to their marriage if your Dad ever learned that?!â

Ronnie looks back at her with a downcast expression. âDad and I have never been real close. Weâre not like you and your Dad, Doreen,â he answers.

Tears drip down Doreenâs cheeks. âThatâs not the point, Ronnie! When youâre close to someone and then they keep something from you, something this important in their livesâ¦you feel betrayed!â she replies. âThatâs how heâll feelâ¦Thatâs how I feel! Your concealing your being Firestorm makes me wonder if I ever knew you, Ronnie!â

Knock! Knock! Bree opens the door and leans in. âUhhh, guys? Look, Iâm sorry to interrupt whatever youâre doing, but thereâs some people here looking for Ronnie and I think itâs pretty important,â she tells them. She opens the door wider. Professor Stein stands next to her beside two police officers.

âRonald, I think you should come with these policemen,â Stein tells him. âI went down to the station to inquire about the Carmichael boyâ¦â

Doreen stands up. âCliff? Whatâs the matter with Cliff?â she asks.

âHe was the young man who attempted to throw himself from the roof of the building, Miss Day,â Professor Stein answers her.

âOh noâ¦No!â Doreen sobs.

âYes, well. Carmichael was talking with a psychiatrist at the station,â Stein continues. âI believe itâs important Ronald should hear what heâs saying. As should you, Miss Day. Will you come?â They all head out and start down the hall towards the exit.

âUhhh, do you guys think I could stop at my locker and change along the way?â Ronnie asks. âIâm leaving cleat marks all over the place.â

One quick change laterâ¦A steady rain falls outside Pittsburgh Police Precinct 101. Professor Stein guides the group up the entrance steps. âThis way,â he tells them as they enter the lobby. âOur contact is Captain Turillen, the Day Watch Commander,â he explains.

Ronnie looks around the busy station. âWhy is it every time I enter a police station, I think theyâre going to arrest me for what I did to Mrs. Stevensâ cat when I was five?â he thinks.

Captain Turillen recognizes Professor Stein in the crowd and walks over to the group. âThank you all for coming down,â Turillen tells them. âCarmichaelâs been suggesting some things that I hope you two could either corroborate or deny.â He leads them to the interrogation area and into an observation room. âHeâs being questioned right now,â Turillen continues. âHe refused to name a lawyer, so thereâs a public defender, Miss Joy Ravenport, in with him. You can watch from here. Itâs a one-way mirror. And thereâs also a loudspeaker. Youâll be able to see and hear him, but he wonât know youâre here.â

The group files in, taking places alongside the observation window. Cliff sits inside at a table with Ms. Ravenport. Two men review documents and take notes as the questioning continues. âShut up, Mr. Carmichael!â Ravenport barks at her client.

âMuch against the advice of Ms. Ravenport, her client has gotten âcooperativeâ,â Captain Turillen explains.

âFreak off, lady! I didnât ask for you and I donât want you!â Cliff snarls at her angrily. âI want to talk; Iâve got to talk, donât you understand, you stupid bimbo? âIâm guilty! I cut the strap on the helmet that paralyzed my cousin Hugo!â

Ravenport tries to calm him. âYour legal culpability will be decided in a court of law,â she answers. âNow, exercise your right to be silent so I can do my job!â

Cliff shakes his head, looking downtrodden. âI canât bear the guilt anymore. I donât want to get off!â he replies quickly. âYou too stupid to understand that? I want to be punished!â

âWhereâs this football helmet now?â she asks with a sigh.

âSomeone noticed the cut, so I stole the helmet and chucked it in the river,â Cliff explains. âYou think Iâm stupid enough to hang on to that?â

Detective Lieutenant Blum stands behind Cliff looking over some documents. âYou said your intended target was another player, a Ronald Raymond?â he asks.

âYeah, olâ Ronnie. It was his helmet,â Cliff answers. âHugo somehow wound up wearing it and it snapped off during a play. Hugo got hurtâ¦paralyzed.â

The police psychiatrist checks his notes. âThis girl, Doreen Day, that you mentioned. You used to date her before âRonnieâ showed up. Is she the reason you cut the helmet strap? To get back at Raymond for having taken Miss Day away from you?â he asks.

âGet serious,â Cliff scoffs as Doreen watches in shock. âRaymond couldnât have taken anything away from me that I really wanted,â Cliff continues. âRaymondâs one of these big dumb jocks who thinks the world spins around him because heâs good at childrenâs games. If you ask me, thatâs whatâs wrong with this country: Making heroes out of big dumb jocks. I just wanted to take him down a peg or two.â

The psychiatrist asks, âEven if you had to cripple him?â

Ravenport quickly interjects, âDonât answer that.â

Cliff glares at her angrily. âBlow it out your briefcase,â he answers. âNo, I wasnât trying to cripple Raymond, but I wouldnât have shed any tears if I had. Know what I think? I think Raymond saw the cut and knew Iâd done it. So, to get back at me, he gives his helmet to Hugo, figuring that something would happen to Hugo. Raymondâs the one you should be questioning, not me!â

Ms. Ravenport, Lt. Blum, and the psychiatrist look at him in shock for a moment. âWeâre done with questioning for the day, I think,â the psychiatrist says as he gets up from the table. âLt. Blum, Ms. Ravenport - - would you please join me in the corridor?â he asks.

The three file out, joining Captain Turillen and the others in the observation room. âWell? Whatâve we got?â Turillen asks.

âWell, the kid should go into psychiatric observation because of the suicide attempt, for starters,â the psychiatrist answers.

âWhat about the chin strap? Attempted murder?â Turillen asks.

âWell, Captain, thereâs bound to be some question whether he was mentally competent when he committed the act,â Blum replies.

âIf he committed the act,â Ravenport adds.

âThat, too,â Turillen nods. âIf he did and if he was, was the kid competent when he confessed to it?â

Ravenport shakes her head. âLetâs be real, boys. Try to bring that âconfessionâ into a court of law and Iâll stuff it back up your shorts,â she tells them.

âIn any case, thatâs one troubled young man in there,â Turillen continues. âCan we all agree he gets remanded for psychiatric care while we try to locate his parents or guardian or whatever? See about getting him some long-range professional care?â

âAgreed, conditionally,.â Ravenport nods.

Blum and the psychiatrist reply, âAgreed.â

Turillen turns to Ronnie and Doreen. He shakes Ronnieâs hand. âThanks for coming down, you two. Sorry it was a waste of time,â he tells them.

âThatâs okay. I learned a lot,â Ronnie answers. âI learned just how much Cliff Carmichael hates me.â

Professor Stein, Ronnie, and Doreen head out the exit into the steady rain. Doreen pops her umbrella over her head. âHow about you, Doreen? You hate me, too?â Ronnie asks her.

âOh, Ronnie! Honestly!â she sighs. âI donât hate you, but I donât know what I feel for you right now. I think itâs better we didnât see each other for awhile. You and the Professor donât have to worry. I wonât tell anyone about yourâ¦your âsecret identities.ââ

Ronnie reaches for her but she turns away. âAaahâ¦swell. Great,â he says softly.

âAnd Ronnie? Call you Dad soon, okay? Let him know,â she says as she walks away.

Ronnie stands in the rain, watching her walk off. Professor Stein asks, âRonald, are you all right?â

Ronnie turns to him. âYeahâ¦no. I donât know,â he replies. âI think I managed to mangle another one of my relationships. Itâs getting to be a bad habit. I think itâs time to break this habit. Maybe start putting some back together. Wanna volunteer?â

âIâd like to very much, Ronald. Please,â Stein replies. They turn to walk in the rain back to campus.

Itâs better to light a single candle than to curse the darkness. These two friends have decided to do that: To find that which binds them one to the other and bridges the gaps. They will need that friendship in the days ahead. BRRRKOOMM! For it is a world increasingly lit by lightning.
name: Secret Identities

description:
Arisia endures terrible abuse while under the mind control of Hector Hammond and Star Sapphire. Meanwhile Hal struggles to escape the villains trap and save his lover from their control.

Notes:
name: For Want of a Male...!
The Saga of Solomon Grundy

description: The four Legionnaires arrive on Earth to find Universo, the person behind the recent troubles in their lives. Believing that Universo is masquerading as the President of Earth, they reach his offices to learn that it's not the President, but someone close to them. They are then forced to fighting some of their teammates from the Legion of Super-Heroes, hypnotized by Universo. Saturn Girl takes on Universo directly, and wins. After the battle, she returns to active duty as a member of the Legion of Super-Heroes.
name: Forgotten Friends

description: In the aftermath of an epic battle with Brother Blood, the Titans relax, recuperate, and take a vacation. But trouble always seems to have a way of finding them.
name: Trivial Pursuits

description: The Masters of Disaster spring their trap in "...An Ill Wind..."
name: ...an Ill Wind...

description: Hub City goes wild as the Mayor's mansion burns; The Question has the futile task of trying to keep order; Vic decides to return to the news business; Izzy cleans up his crooked cop act.
name: Cityscape

description:
1. Cover by Ed Hannigan and Dick Giordano.
  2. "Death Like a Crown" written by Andrew Helfer, penciled by Kevin Maguire, inked by Dick Giordano, colored by Adrienne Roy and lettered by Bob Lappan.
  3. "The Secret Origin of the Spectre" written by Roy Thomas, penciled and inked by Michael T. Gilbert, colored by Carl Gafford and lettered by Agustin Mas.
  4. "Secrets Behind the Origins Dept.:" 1/3 page text piece on the history of the Spectre by Roy Thomas.

Note: The Spectre story is based off of More Fun Comics issues 52-54.
name: Death Like a Crown / The Secret Origin of the Spectre

description: Captain Marvel has met his predecessor in battle and failed. Black Adam was wielding the power of the wizard Shazam 5,000 years before Billy Batson was even born. Can Billy find a way to defeat his foe, a being who can match his every move and then some? Perhaps the answer lies within the origin of Black Adam.
name: "A" is for Stamina... "Z" is for Power...

description:
1. Cover by Michael William Kaluta.
  2. "Justice Beyond the Flesh" written by Doug Moench, penciled by Gene Colan, inked by Steve Mitchell, colored by Adrienne Roy and lettered by John Costanza.

Notes:

  • Phantom Stranger cameo.
name: Justice Beyond the Flesh

description: The crew investigates a mysterious planet, where only two brain-wave patterns are detected among numerous life forms, in "When You Wish Upon A Star...!" Part 1 of 2, continued next issue.
name: When You Wish Upon A Star...!

description:
The Squad takes the fight to Qurac to put an end to the Jihad before the terrorist organization can go on its first mission--and one of the Squad isn't coming back alive!

The Suicide Squad enters Quarac to defeat the Jihad, which they do successfully. True to their name, though, not all the members of the Suicide Squad survive the experience.
name: Trial by Fire

description:
"The Last Five-Hundred!" Part 2 of 2. Superman is one of the mightiest heroes in the universe, but can even his great powers compare to the abilities of the Last 500? And, can the Man of Steel somehow find a way to defeat this new foe without hurting his friends, whose minds have been usurped by his enemy?

Notes:

  • A letter to the editor from T. M. Maple.
name: The Last Five Hundred

description: Includes 2 pinups, the first by Bill Sienkiewicz and the second by Walt Simonson.
name: All Flesh is Grass

description:
Overview

Gorilla Grodd attempts to conquer Gorilla City by taking over the minds of the other ape-themed superheroes and supervillains on the planet. For some reason his psychic powers also affect Swamp Thing. He is ultimately defeated when he attempts to stretch his psychic abilities too far and damages his brain.
name: Distant Cousins

description: Reprint of The New Teen Titans #19.
name: Breaking Up Is Hard to Do!
Of Captives And Cannibals...Scavengers And Kings!

description:
Paradise Island is unhappy as well as the Amazons as Ares is taking over Manâs World, and his influence is obviously growing as the flowers in Themyscira start dying. Menalippe stares into her cauldron and Hippolyta impatiently waits for the future. Hippolyta suspects that she is hiding something and as can only tell her about the evil that lies underneath this island. Why does Apollo not answer their prayers? Meanwhile in Mount Olympus, Artemis tries to wake her brother, Apollo up. He accuses him of being a coward, but Hermes replies saying that he usually takes a pragmatic approach to most situations. Artemis says that they should face their fate on their feet, not lying down. Artemis refuses to believe that this is happening to her but Athena responds that it is up to Diana to save them.

On Manâs World, Steve Trevor is still considered a murderer and at a press conference General Sam Tolliver claims that he is a spy. The whereabouts of Wonder Woman are still unknown as the police offer a reward for anyone that has some information on her. Unknown to the public, Diana is at Julia Kapatelisâ house caring for Etta treating the bump in her head. She asks Colonel Michaelis what is going on and Michaelis apologises and said that he had startled her and she tripped. Steve also wants to help Diana, but it is up to her with what to do next. Etta is confused, so Diana produces the Talisman and tells them that is has something to do with this. Etta disagrees and brings out the file that she stole. Diana reads it and finds it says âThe Ares Projectâ.

Under Earth, Deimos holds his Talisman and feels the excitement that their plan will finally take off. Phobos however still feels worthless for failing to please his father and intends to do something about it.

Hours later at the Kapatelis house, Julia is trying to decipher it if and Diana asks if she has deciphered it. Apparently, the marks translate into geometric patterns with a focal point in the Vulture. Diana tells Julia to go to sleep and she feels that this pattern looks familiar. She wonders if the others can help, but they are fast asleep as Steve had pinned up a chart. The chart looks exactly like the mark on the Talisman. She wakes the others, claiming that she has found the answer.

Elsewhere, General Tolliver and his troops take over a secret military factory.

Back at the winter retreat, everyone is around a map. It seems that when the mirror image of the Talisman is held over the map it marks the bloodiest battles of Ancient Greece and when it is laid over the map of Earth, it points to all these nuclear bases. It then points to the upper Midwestern United States and must be the focal point for the Ares Project.

Colonel Michaelis phones General Hillary telling him that the world is at stake, then General Hillaryâs aide bursts in to inform him that one of their military bases has been taken over by rogue troops. The base is also ready for a nuclear launch. Michealis, hearing this over the phone tells him that it is too late. Steve finds out and plans to stop him, but they need a plan first. Diana comes out in her costume and tells them that they need to find the other half of the Talisman because joining them will lead her to Ares. Diana says that this is her job, but Julia insists that they come along. Even though Diana says no, Steve, Etta and Michaelis grab their weapons, and Diana realises that her friends will stand by her no matter what. Diana wonders why they do so when they are so frail compared to her. As Diana slowly connects the Talisman in the mirror, and Etta questions why they put so much faith in her. Steve cannot explain, but Diana reminds him of his mother. The Talisman touches itâs reflection in the mirror, and the world then turns totally upside down, where it is hot as Hell and as cold as ice. Then, they find themselves in the domain of Deimos. He also convinces Diana to try and get the other half of the amulet. Julia then asks Diana who he is and he introduces himself as Deimos, âson of Ares, Master of Duplicity and Sovereign of the Serpents!â Then, several snakes attack Diana causing her to drop the amulet. Julia picks it up as Steve fires on the snakes. The others join in on the fight, and Phobos watches on. Even though Phobos does not really enjoy his brotherâs company, he cannot see him be beaten by mortals. He uses his powers to bring up the things that they fear the most. Diana finishes up on the snakes and goes for the large cat in which Michealis fears and hits it with a mighty punch. Michealis tells Steve that he will take care of his fear, and that Steve should help the others. Juliaâs fear was drowning and Diana saves her from it while Steve digs Etta out, as her fear is being buried alive. Phobos is about to attack him but before he can, Michaelis fires upon him allowing Steve to save Etta. She is free, but Phobos then unleashes his power on them.

Deimos tells Wonder Woman that her friends cannot stand up to the gods. Wonder Woman lays Julia on the ground, exclaiming that she does not fear him. Deimos disagrees however and turns her hair into snakes and her snake hairs inject their venom into them. Julia says that she will help, but Diana rejects her help, saying that she must defeat him alone. She looks around, and her friends are unconscious. She then uses her tiara to cut through her hair and then decapitating Deimos. Wonder Woman goes over to his dead corpse and takes the other half of the amulet from him and Phobos flees. Julia asks what they shall do as the others come to. The amulet comes together and they vanish into the control room of a missile base surrounded by General Tolliverâs troops. He points towards a screen to show a missile that is preparing to launch and tell them to witness his victory. The missile is then surrounded in a strange light, and the weapon takes on a new form. Wonder Woman knows to well who this is: Ares.
name: The Ares Assault

description:
1. Cover by Brian Murray.
  2. "The Coming of the Young All-Stars" written by Roy and Dann Thomas, penciled by Vince Argondezzi (pages 1-5), Michael Bair and Brian Murray (pages 6-26), inked by Malcolm Jones 3rd, colored by Carl Gafford and lettered by David C. Weiss.
  3. Untitled 1 page text piece by Roy Thomas.

Notes:

  • Most characters appear in a dream sequence.

Helena Kosmatos awakes from a nightmare. She retells the dream to her "Aunt and Uncle." They reveal their true identities as Johnny Quick and Liberty Belle of the Justice Society of America. Near Santa Barbara, Neptune Perkins and Tsunami meet up and exchange recent happenings in their lives. They agree to go to Hollywood together. Flying Fox encounters a few Spitfire's over Canadian airspace. He eludes the planes. TNT and Dyna-Mite foil a sabotage attempt at a dam in Colorado. During their pursuit of three of the saboteurs, they receive assistance from "Iron" Munro. However, TNT is killed after his vehicle's tire is shoot out. Gudra of Axis Amerika arrives. She claims TNT's soul.
name: The Coming of the Young All-Stars

volume.name: Detectives, Inc.: A Terror of Dying Dreams

description: Doc Stearn chases a thief through a hole into a dimension in 6-D!

Actor Joseph Quist finds himself transported to the realm of Xoo, where animals walk like men and the men and women are a bit of a subclass. He quickly runs afoul of Cardinal Fengk and shortly after escaping his Demon Musketeers, he's struck unconscious and kidnapped by two mysterious ghosts.

Four super-powered juvenile offenders are given an opportunity to repay their debt to society. They are offered membership in the Liberty Project. The project provides an opportunity to assist law enforcement officers in the apprehension of other powered criminals. Slick, Crackshot, Cimarron and Burnout are sent to apprehend Johnny Savage. Savage escapes. Will the team take this as an opportunity to escape?
name: I Fought The Law
